Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/3-Toxic-Parenting-Situations-That-Turn-Kids-Into-Narcissists.html
Avoid these harmful parenting behaviors to raise healthy and well-adjusted children.
John grew up with a narcissistic mother who always put her own needs before his. She would guilt-trip him into doing things for her and criticize him if he didn't. As a result, John grew up feeling like he was never good enough and that his own needs and wants didn't matter.
This is just one example of how a narcissistic parent can harm their child's development. Narcissistic parents are focused on their own needs, desires, and achievements, often at the expense of their children's well-being. This can lead children to develop narcissistic traits themselves, in an attempt to win their parent's approval or to protect their own fragile sense of self.
Sara always felt like she couldn't do anything right in the eyes of her father. He would nitpick every little thing she did and compare her unfavorably to her siblings or other children. As a result, Sara developed a deep sense of shame and inferiority that affected her self-esteem well into adulthood.
Overly critical parents can damage their child's self-worth and lead them to develop a perfectionist mindset, where they feel they always have to be the best at everything to be accepted and loved. This can cause anxiety, depression, and other mental health issues in the long run.
Rachel grew up with a mother who was overly involved in her life, to the point of invading her privacy and ignoring her boundaries. Her mother would read her diary, listen in on her phone calls, and make decisions for her without her input. Rachel felt suffocated and trapped, unable to develop her own identity separate from her mother's.
Enmeshed parents can hinder their child's ability to develop autonomy and independence, leading them to feel powerless and resentful towards their parent. This can also lead to an unhealthy dependency on the parent, where the child feels they always need their parent's approval and validation to feel okay.
Toxic parenting can have a lasting impact on a child's development, leading them to develop narcissistic traits, perfectionism, anxiety, depression, and low self-esteem. If you recognize yourself in any of these toxic parenting situations, seek professional help and guidance to break the cycle and raise healthy and well-adjusted children.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/A-South-African-Mom-s-Unbelievable-Parenting-Journey-UNICEF.html
As a single mother in South Africa, Thandiwe faced numerous challenges in raising her children. She had to work long hours just to provide for her family, often leaving her kids alone at home. They would spend most of their days watching TV or playing outside without much supervision.
One day, Thandiwe came across a UNICEF program that aimed to help single mothers like her. She was hesitant at first, feeling embarrassed and like a failure for needing help. But she decided to give it a try.
UNICEF's program provided Thandiwe with the support and resources she needed to become a better parent. She learned how to set boundaries and rules for her children, and how to communicate with them effectively. She also learned how to manage her finances and plan for the future.
With the program's help, Thandiwe was able to provide a stable and healthy environment for her children. They started doing better in school and were more well-behaved at home. Thandiwe also found a community of other single mothers who she could relate to and seek advice from.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/An-Easy-Way-to-Clean-Your-Kids-Teeth-Parenting-Expert.html
As a parenting expert, I've seen many parents struggle with getting their kids to brush their teeth. It can be a daily battle that leaves both the parent and the child frustrated. But, what if I told you there's an easier way to clean your kids' teeth without having to fight over a toothbrush and paste?
It all starts with understanding the importance of oral hygiene and dental health. According to the American Dental Association, children should start brushing their teeth as soon as the first tooth appears, and a visit to the dentist should occur no later than the child's first birthday.
But, brushing teeth can be difficult for young children, especially those who are teething or have sensitive gums. That's where this easy technique comes in. It's painless, quick, and effective.
Instead of using a toothbrush and paste, try cleaning your child's teeth with a soft, damp cloth. Simply wrap the cloth around your finger, wet it with water, and gently wipe the teeth and gums. This not only removes plaque and bacteria, but it also gets your child used to having their mouth cleaned daily.
You can also make the process fun by using a colorful cloth or singing a song while you clean. The key is to make it an enjoyable activity that your child looks forward to.
For added protection, you can also use a fluoride rinse or gel that you apply directly to the teeth with a cotton swab. This can help strengthen the enamel and prevent cavities.
Now, you may be wondering if this technique is as effective as using a toothbrush and paste. While it's true that brushing with a toothbrush and paste is the most effective way to clean teeth, using a soft cloth can still provide benefits.
In fact, a study by the Journal of Dentistry for Children found that wiping a baby's teeth with a soft cloth was just as effective as using a toothbrush and paste in reducing plaque and bacteria.
Of course, as your child gets older and more teeth come in, you will want to transition to a toothbrush and paste. But, for young children and infants, the soft cloth technique can be a great way to establish good oral hygiene habits.
Here are some additional tips to make teeth cleaning easier for you and your child:

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Anti-Dopamine-Parenting-A-Solution-to-Your-Kid-s-Craving-for-Screens-or-Sweets.html
Almost every parent worries about their child's love for screens or sweets. With easy access to mobile devices and junk food, it's difficult to keep children away from these temptations. The problem is, both screens and sweets stimulate the pleasure center of the brain by releasing dopamine, a feel-good neurotransmitter. This makes children crave more of them, leading to addiction-like behavior.
Fortunately, there's a solution: Anti-Dopamine Parenting. This type of parenting involves limiting your child's exposure to dopamine-boosting stimuli and encouraging other healthy activities. By doing so, you can significantly reduce your child's cravings for screens or sweets, and help them develop better habits.
Anti-Dopamine Parenting is a parenting style that aims to reduce your child's exposure to dopamine-boosting stimuli, such as screens and sweets. By doing so, you can help your child develop better habits and avoid addiction-like behavior. Here are some key principles of Anti-Dopamine Parenting:
Anti-Dopamine Parenting has already shown promising results in helping children develop better habits and reducing their cravings for screens or sweets. Here are some examples:
Anti-Dopamine Parenting is a new and effective solution to curb your kid's craving for screens or sweets. By limiting your child's exposure to dopamine-boosting stimuli and encouraging healthy activities, you can help your child develop better habits and avoid addiction-like behavior. Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Co-Parenting-with-Exes-Lessons-from-Jennifer-Garner-and-Sheryl-Lee-Ralph.html
When Hollywood power couple Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck split in 2015, many fans assumed the worst for their three children. But the exes surprised everyone by committing to co-parenting their kids, Violet, Seraphina, and Samuel, as a team. "We don't have a choice," Garner told People magazine in 2018. "We are definitely a modern family."
Their dedication to their kids has been evident in interviews, social media posts, and public appearances. They attend events and milestones together, share parenting responsibilities, and even vacation as a family. Their mutual respect and affection for each other has inspired many parents going through a divorce or separation to follow their example.
Remember that the purpose of co-parenting is to provide a stable, nurturing, and respectful environment for your children, regardless of your personal feelings or issues with your ex-spouse or partner. Your children's needs and interests should always come first, and you should try to minimize conflict, stress, and disruptions for them as much as possible.
Communication is key in co-parenting, but it can also be challenging when emotions are high and tensions are present. Be clear, concise, and respectful when you talk or write to your ex about scheduling, logistics, rules, discipline, and other concerns that affect your children. Try to avoid blaming, criticizing, or insulting each other, and listen actively to each other's perspectives.
Co-parenting works best when both parties are on the same page about their roles, responsibilities, and boundaries. Discuss and agree on issues such as discipline, health care, education, extracurricular activities, and holidays, and make a written plan or agreement if possible. Stick to your commitments, but also be flexible and willing to compromise when necessary.
Remember that co-parenting is not easy, but it is worth the effort for the sake of your children and your own well-being and happiness. Seek help from professionals, such as therapists, mediators, or lawyers, if you encounter difficulties or disagreements that you cannot resolve on your own.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Eva-Longoria-Interrupted-During-Flamin-Hot-Event.html
Eva Longoria recently attended an event to promote the new Flamin' Hot Cheetos movie, and she had an unexpected visitor that stole the show.
As she was speaking to the audience, her son Santiago ran onto the stage and hugged her. The moment was captured on camera and shared widely on social media, with fans commenting on how heartwarming it was to see the mother-son love.
But amidst this adorable interruption, Longoria didn't lose her train of thought. She seamlessly continued with her speech, showing the audience how a working mom can handle any situation.
This moment highlights how important it is to have a supportive family and be able to balance work and personal life. Eva Longoria is a great example of how one can be a successful actor while also being a great mom.
Overall, Eva Longoria's adorable interruption during the Flamin' Hot event showed her true character and resilience. Despite the unexpected interruption, she gracefully continued with her speech, showing how one can balance work and family life with ease. Her love for her son is apparent, and it's a great reminder that family support is key in achieving success.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Father-s-Day-Values-A-New-Father-s-Reflections-on-Parenting.html
I never knew what it truly meant to be a father until I held my child for the first time. The overwhelming feeling of love and responsibility hit me like a ton of bricks. As I navigated through the early stages of parenthood, I realized that there were certain values that I wanted to instill in my child. Here are some of the values that I have come to appreciate as a father:
As a parent, time is the most precious resource that we have. Our children grow up so fast and before we know it, they will be all grown up and moving out of the house. I realized that in order to build a strong relationship with my child, I needed to prioritize my time with them. This meant being present during meal times, bedtime, and playtime. I made a conscious effort to put away my phone, turn off the TV, and simply be in the moment with my child. The result was a deeper connection and sense of trust between us.
One quantifiable example of this was when I started tracking the amount of quality time that I spent with my child each day. I used a timer to ensure that I was giving my child my undivided attention for at least an hour each day. Over time, I saw a noticeable improvement in our relationship and my child's behavior.
I believe that respect is one of the most important values that we can teach our children. Respect for oneself, others, and the world around us. As a father, I try to lead by example by treating my child with respect and expecting the same in return. This means listening to my child's opinions, thoughts, and feelings, even if I don't necessarily agree with them. It also means teaching my child to be respectful towards others, regardless of their differences.
A personal anecdote that illustrates this value was when I took my child to the playground and saw another child being bullied. I used this as an opportunity to teach my child about respecting others and standing up for what is right. We went over and intervened, and my child learned firsthand the importance of respecting others.
Parenting can be tough and sometimes it feels like we are not making any progress. However, the value of perseverance is something that I have come to appreciate as a father. This means not giving up on our children, even when they make mistakes or act out. It means being patient and consistent in our efforts to teach and guide them.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Healing-through-Conscious-Parenting.html
When we found out we were pregnant, my husband and I couldn't have been more thrilled. We spent hours reading parenting books, attending classes and creating the perfect nursery. We thought we had it all figured out and were ready to be the best parents in the world.
But once our son was born, we quickly realized that we had no idea what we were doing. We were sleep deprived, overwhelmed and anxious. The more we tried to be perfect parents, the more stressed and unhappy we became. It wasn't until we decided to put our own healing and well-being first that we were able to become the parents we wanted to be.
Before we can effectively nurture our children, we need to heal ourselves. This means addressing and resolving any emotional wounds, traumas or patterns that may hinder our ability to connect with our children in a positive way. These may include childhood experiences, relationship issues, self-esteem struggles or mental health concerns.
Some quantifiable examples of how self-healing can lead to conscious parenting are:
Conscious parenting involves being present, aware and attuned to our children's physical, emotional and spiritual needs. It means having a deep understanding of their developmental stages, personality traits and unique strengths. When we approach parenting from a place of consciousness, we create a safe and nurturing environment that allows our children to flourish.
Some practical tips for practicing conscious parenting include:
To sum up, the journey of conscious parenting starts with a commitment to our own healing and well-being. By doing the necessary personal work, we can become more attuned to our children's needs and create a nurturing environment that allows them to thrive. Remember to:
With these tools, we can create happy and healthy parent-child relationships that will last a lifetime.

One day, they both realized that they also shared a common dream: to become parents. However, they did not want to go through the conventional route of marriage or adoption. They wanted to co-parent as friends, without any romantic or sexual involvement. They did their research, consulted lawyers and therapists, and decided to give it a try.

They share the custody, expenses, and decision-making equally. They celebrate their kids' birthdays, attend their school events, and go on vacations together. They are happy, fulfilled, and confident that they are doing the right thing.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Positive-Parenting-and-Youth-Stress-Impact.html
There was once a young girl named Lily who constantly felt stressed and anxious. Her parents knew that their daughter was struggling but didn't know how to help her. One day, they stumbled upon an article about positive parenting and its effect on youth stress impact. After implementing the principles of positive parenting, Lily's stress levels significantly decreased, and she was able to enjoy a much happier and healthier life.
Positive parenting is an approach to parenting that emphasizes encouragement, communication, and support. It focuses on building and strengthening the relationship between parents and children, rather than just setting rules and disciplining them.
Research shows that positive parenting has numerous benefits for children, including improved mental health, better behavior, and increased confidence. It also reduces stress and anxiety in children, which can have lasting effects on their lives.
Stress is a normal part of life, but when it becomes overwhelming, it can have serious negative effects on youth. Studies show that the more stress a child experiences, the more likely they are to develop mental health problems like depression and anxiety.
Stress can also affect a child's physical health, causing headaches, stomachaches, and sleep problems. It can also impact their academic performance, leading to poor grades and difficulty concentrating in school.
There are many different positive parenting techniques that parents can use to reduce stress in their children's lives. These include:
In conclusion, positive parenting can have a significant impact on youth stress levels. By using techniques like active listening, encouragement, and limits, parents can create a supportive and nurturing environment for their children. This not only reduces stress and anxiety but also leads to improved mental health and academic performance.

Read Full Article on https://akash.mittal.blog/parenting/2023/6/18/Step-into-the-Future-of-Parenting-with-thatindianchick-s-Hilarious-Glimpse-into-2050.html
In a world where technology is advancing faster than ever, it's no surprise that parenting is changing too. @thatindianchick_ takes us on a hilarious journey to the year 2050, where parenting looks quite different than it does today. With her sharp wit and spot-on observations, she offers us a glimpse into what the future of parenting could hold.
In 2050, technology has completely revolutionized the way we parent. From diaper-changing robots to virtual classrooms, parenting in the future is a high-tech affair.
One of the biggest changes is the prevalence of virtual reality. Parents are now able to immerse their children in educational and entertaining experiences from the comfort of their own home. Imagine taking your child on a virtual safari or exploring the depths of the ocean without ever leaving your living room. It's an incredible development that opens up a world of possibilities for parents and children alike.
Another major change is the way parents keep track of their children. With GPS tracking and 24/7 monitoring systems, parents can know their child's location and activity at all times. It's a controversial development, with some arguing that it's an invasion of privacy and others saying it provides peace of mind in an increasingly dangerous world.
In the future, the traditional nuclear family has become less common. Instead, we're seeing a rise in non-traditional family units, such as single-parent households and same-sex parenting. With the help of technology, these families are able to create strong bonds and provide nurturing environments for their children.
Not only that, but families are also becoming more international. With the ease of travel and communication, it's now possible for families to be spread across the globe. While it may seem daunting at first, the rise of technology has made it easier than ever to stay connected and involved in each other's lives.
One thing that hasn't changed in 2050 is the importance of mental health. In fact, it's become even more of a priority. With the rise of social media and the pressure to always be "on", there's a growing awareness of the need for self-care and mental health support.
In the future, counseling and therapy are seen as just as important as physical check-ups. Parents are encouraged to take care of their mental health so they can be the best possible caregivers for their childre
